tags.description: Set up schedules to generate SIA reports.
tags.name: Report schedules

get.description: Lists all configured report schedules for a given configuration.

items.description: Report scheduling configuration, on a daily or weekly basis.

createdBy.description: The user who initially created the report schedule configuration.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking the report schedule configuration's creation.

siteIds.description: The site IDs applicable to the report.

dayOfWeek.description: Specifies the day of the week to generate the report. Refer to [Report scheduling](ref:report-scheduling) for details.

emails.description: Specifies the email addresses to send generated reports.

filters.description: Specifies filters to apply while generating the report.
Filter strings to exclude or include report data. Refer to [Filters object](ref:filters) for a complete list.

modifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the report schedule configuration.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp string marking the report schedule configuration's last modification.

recurrence.description: Specifies the frequency of the report schedule, either `DAILY`, or `WEEKLY`.

reportTemplate.description: Specifies the report template. The only currently supported syntax is `THREAT_EVENTS_BY_LOCATION_AND_DOMAIN`.

scheduleId.description: A unique identifier for the report schedule configuration.

status.description: Specifies the status of the report schedule configuration, either `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

useFilters.description: Indicates if the report should use filters.

userTimeZone.description: Specifies a user timezone offset for generating the report. For example, `-05:00`.

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: The system cannot understand your request.  Please check the syntax and correct any problems.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. The error response includes this list if there are several problems with a single request, to call out each of them separately.

items.description: A nested problem response error object.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. The error response includes this list if there are several problems with a single request, to call out each of them separately.

items.description: A nested problem response error object.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. The error response includes this list if there are several problems with a single request, to call out each of them separately.

items.description: A nested problem response error object.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for each configuration.
parameters.name: configId

post.description: Creates a new report schedule for a given SIA configuration.

schema.description: Configures daily or weekly scheduled reports.

siteIds.description: The site IDs for the report.

dayOfWeek.description: Specifies the day of the week to generate the report. Refer to [Report scheduling](ref:report-scheduling) for details.

emails.description: Specifies the email addresses to send generated reports.

filters.description: Optional filters to apply while generating the report.
Filter strings to exclude or include report data. See the [Filters](ref:filters) object for a complete list.

recurrence.description: The report schedule frequency, either `DAILY`, or `WEEKLY`. Refer to [Report scheduling](ref:report-scheduling) for details.

reportTemplate.description: The report template. The only currently supported syntax is `THREAT_EVENTS_BY_LOCATION_AND_DOMAIN`.

scheduleId.description: __Read-only__ A unique identifier for the report schedule configuration.

status.description: The report schedule configuration status, either `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

useFilters.description: Indicates if the report should use filters.

userTimeZone.description: Specifies a user-timezone-offset for generating the report. For example, `-05:00`.

scheduleId.description: A unique identifier for the report schedule configuration.

status.description: Specifies the status of the report schedule configuration, either `ENABLED` or `DISABLED`.

useFilters.description: Indicates if the report should use filters.

userTimeZone.description: Specifies a user timezone offset for generating the report. For example, `-05:00`.
